body_html: Indeed - it's a difficult error to disallow, because there are many totally valid patterns that involve adding nodes to the graph. One tip is to try calling tf.get_default_graph().finalize() before your training loop, so that an error will be thrown if you accidentally add a node. (However, we can't do that automatically - e.g. on the first run() call - because it would break a huge number of people :( ...)

body: Indeed - it's a difficult error to disallow, because there are many totally valid patterns that involve adding nodes to the graph. One tip is to try calling `tf.get_default_graph().finalize()` before your training loop, so that an error will be thrown if you accidentally add a node. (However, we can't do that automatically - e.g. on the first `run()` call - because it would break a huge number of people :( ...)
